content.text: Industry analysis studies the overall environment in which a company operates. It looks at demand, competition, regulations, and growth prospects of the sector. A good company in a bad industry may still struggle.
Even strong companies cannot grow if the industry itself is shrinking. Investors prefer industries that benefit from long-term trends such as urbanization, rising incomes, or digital adoption.
Look at market size, number of competitors, government regulation, and price sensitivity. Also check whether profits are spread across many players or concentrated among leaders.
For example, highly competitive industries usually have lower profit margins, while industries with strong entry barriers often allow companies to earn higher profits.
